page.title: 06Housing in Ufton and Area.
page.content: There are 13 farmhouses, two public houses with living accomodation and 100 other residences. 83 houses are in the village of Ufton (68 in 1969).13 are in or near Bascote Heath. Recently a number of stone barns have been converted into houses and new detached properties have been built in three ex-farmyards. There are now 30 detached houses in Ufton. 12 houses are of local limestone. There is one row of brick semi-detached houses and another which includes old peoples bungalows. At Bascote Heath houses are mainly large detached and modern. Three have swimming pools. This housing pattern reflects the relatively recent influx of newcomers to the village.There are 15 more houses than in 1969.
